news_header: UK inflation rose to 3% in January due to food prices and airfares, prompting concerns about living costs.
news_original_title: Inflation jumps on food, air fares and school fees
news_text: UK inflation surged to 3% in January, driven by rising food prices, airfares, and private school fees. The government warned of a challenging path to low inflation, while households brace for higher living costs. Some economists speculate on the Bank of England's response regarding interest rates amid ongoing economic pressures.
